content:
Going back is not a supported process and may result in problems. But The space issue tends to be a bad hidden configuration setting.

Check the Config Editor for this settings:

  • Settings > General
  • scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button

It opens in a new tab

  • In top search type: pixels
  • look for this line : layout.css.devPixelsPerPx
  • default is a negative number -1.0

It should not be in bold text, if bold text then it has been altered.

  • If you have anything else in that setting use the arrow icon on far right - click on it and the default is reset.

Another value to check is mail.uifontsize, what value do you see?

Please post your results


If you want the old toolbar look:

  • right click in the open toolbar space at the top, pick customize - all your familiar buttons are there.
  • remove the icons from the top of folder pane, the settings found in the three dots to the right of "+ New Message"
creator: wsmwk

Yours is the first I've heard report this - consider yourself unique.

A. Collect some data please - shut down Thunderbird, start it up, click in the message list, open error console (ctrl+shift+J), have "Errors" and "Warnings" visible only, right+click in the error list and pick "save all messages to file".

B. Do Help > Troubleshoot Mode - does the problem go away?

Right-click the Unified bar, the one with global search, Customize..., drag the Delete button onto the Unified bar.

Adjust the Font Size and Density from the File menu, or the 3-bar AppMenu.

Set View/Headers to Normal. Press Alt if the Menu Bar with View is hidden.

content: I have no idea what you mean. Thunderbird does not require donations, so it's puzzling whatever you see. The opening page does encourage support, but that's a voluntary thing. And if you don't like the courteous request, you can turn off the opening page at settings>general. The first option there is the start page. Although Thunderbird is free, totally free to use, it still has costs and depends on its users to periodically donate to ensure that Thunderbird doesn't go the way of many prior email clients.
creator: davidsk

content: Try this: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete session.json from the profile. This file stores the layout of TB when it was last closed, and is recreated automatically on restart. Restart TB a few times and see if the layout is restored.

content:
Threads and Folder Pane fonts and backgrounds can be changed with css. 

/* threads pane bg, font */ table[is="tree-view-table"]{ background: #87CEFA !important; font-family: Times !important; font-size: 16px !important; color: navy !important; }  /* folder pane font, bg */ #folderPane { background-color: #87CEFA !important; font-size: 14px !important; font-family: Times !important; color: navy !important; }


To have the font-family applied, check 'Allow messages to use other fonts' in Settings/General/Language & Appearance, Advanced.

Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the numbers and colours as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator
creator: sfhowes
